quotes.quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies, but not the madness of people.
Everything is in motion. Everything flows. Everything is vibrating.
When a person expends the least amount of motion on one action, that is grace
Never confuse motion with action.

Gravity may put the planets into motion, but without the divine Power, it could never put them into such a circulating motion as they have about the Sun; and therefore, for this as well as other reasons, I am compelled to ascribe the frame of this System to an intelligent Agent.
Our nature consists in motion; complete rest is death.
Rest and motion, unrelieved and unchecked, are equally destructive
What you do is your history. What you set in motion is your legacy
A body in motion can maintain this motion only if it remains in contact with a mover.

I guess I’m fascinated with motion because I find that whenever anything is moving, I have some feeling about it. It doesn’t matter what kind of motion it is. A motion will always evoke some kind of reaction.
Time is a perpetual motion, without a single moment of rest.
Everyone who's serious about what they're doing must be in constant motion forward.
A lot of things look cooler in slow motion. Eating isn't one of them.
Thank you... motion sensor hand towel machine. You never work, so I just end up looking like I'm waving hello to a wall robot.
I've always felt music is the only way to give an instantaneous moment the feel of slow motion. To romanticise it and glorify it and give it a soundtrack and a rhythm.
Traveling in the company of those we love is home in motion
Worry is like a rocking chair; it keeps you in motion but gets you nowhere
Some desire is necessary to keep life in motion, and he whose real wants are supplied must admit those of fancy.
Poetry in motion walking by my side, her lovely locomotion keeps my eyes open wide
The drive for happiness is vital; it's what keeps us in motion
A moving body whose motion was not retarded by any resisting force would continue to move to all eternity.
Persistence is nothing more than staying in motion.
Writing is thinking in slow motion.
